title: Physical TV
subtitle: "An abiding sense of inclusivity…in a time...so divisive: an era of insta-hate & antisocial media, refugees banished to remote islands, & walls erected....no “us and them” – only “you and I.” Alison Clifton on 'The short story of you and I' in StylusLit 6 https://styluslit.com/reviews/the-short-story-of-you-and-i/ …pic.twitter.com/pwNimFazk9

title: Managing Migration Project
subtitle: The Liberal Minister for Immigration, Michael MacKeller, ruled out using the island as an of-shore processing centre for refugees at the time. pic.twitter.com/fXLUx9AYXr

title: Managing Migration Project
subtitle:
In 1978, Labour's shadow minister for Aboriginal Affairs and Northern Australia recommended off-shore processing on Christmas Island for Vietnamese refugees. 

More on the idea here: http://soda.naa.gov.au/record/1753170/1 …
#OzHist #auspolpic.twitter.com/M44Gl6lTNz

title: Dr. Carly Copolov
subtitle: I have the honour of working with some of these Bhutanese women through my work for @WestSydHealth. Many of these women spent 20+ years in a refugee camp in Nepal. They always have a big smile on their face and have made Australia their home. #CiCTForum @STARTTSNSWpic.twitter.com/ubZMducmOU – at Fairfield RSL

title: Dr. Carly Copolov
subtitle: Jorge Aroche, CEO of @STARTTSNSW officially launching the Community Living Supports Program for Refugees @newhorizonsau #CiCTForum2019pic.twitter.com/8vLgwFEnvD – at Fairfield RSL

title: Dr. Carly Copolov
subtitle: On @ruokday day we are hearing about the new Community Living Supports Program for #Refugees and Asylum Seekers via support such as assisted daily living, attending appointments, managing medications and counselling and social groups @newhorizonsau @STARTTSNSW #RUOKDaypic.twitter.com/fvgUQaQlfi – at Fairfield RSL

title: Dr. Carly Copolov
subtitle: Hearing from Prof. Peter Shergold AC, Chancellor of @westernsydneyu at the #CiCTForum2019 about NGOs like @STARTTSNSW turning government programs into successful programs for #refugee communities by supporting these communities to take control over their lives in #Auspic.twitter.com/kDUHxuuyOr

Brisbane: King George Square: 12pm
